total_impedance_ori_txt: R3 and R2 connected in series so Rb=R3+R2=2 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm
total_impedance_txt: R3 and R2 connected in series so Rb=R3+R2=2 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on R2?

solution: At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (VS1)
R3 and R2 connected in series so Rb=R3+R2=2 Ohm
Rb and R1 connected in series so Ra=Rb+R1=3 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 3 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R2
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 5 V.
(1) The components Rb,R1 connected in series.
(1) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 5 V.
(1) Rb is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Rb is Rb/Ra*5 V = 3.33 V.
(2) The components R3,R2 connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 3.33 V.
(2) R2 is in the voltage divider so the voltage on R2 is R2/Rb*3.33 V = 1.67 V.
